meanings.definition: A person or thing that burdens or causes difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The burdeners in the story were the villains who made life hard for the hero.
meanings.sent2: The burdeners of the team were the players who always caused trouble.
meanings.sent3: The burdeners in the office were the broken printers that never worked properly.
meanings.sent4: The burdeners in her life were like heavy chains dragging her down.
meanings.sent5: The burdeners in the forest were the fallen trees blocking the path.

meanings.definition: Those who impose a heavy load or responsibility on others.
meanings.sent1: The burdeners expected everyone else to do their work for them.
meanings.sent2: The burdeners of the group were always assigning tasks to others without helping.
meanings.sent3: The burdeners at the picnic were the ants stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: The burdeners in the meeting piled on more work without considering the team's capacity.
meanings.sent5: The burdeners in the family were like bosses giving orders without lifting a finger.
